description: According to our expert chefs, eating pie crust for dinner is highly advisable. We loved this galette (think rustic French tart) so much the first time that we’re bringing it back to the menu. This vegetarian wonder is filled to the brim with a standout medley of seasonal veggies: sautéed organically sourced kale, hearty roasted fennel, and sweet carrots. Topped with taleggio and goat cheese, the balance of sweet and salty flavors is guaranteed to bring about unparalleled amounts of joy this season. Hurray for dinner pies!
name: Rustic Galette with Carrot, Fennel, and Taleggio Cheese
subtitle: with Carrot, Fennel, and Taleggio Cheese
title: Rustic Galette
cooking_tip:
Be sure to read through the entire recipe before you begin cooking. Trust us—you'll be glad you did! 

To remove the core from the fennel half, cut a wedge from its top through the bottom.

If your pie crust is stiff and cracking, allow it to warm up at room temperature for about 5 minutes. Doing so will make it pliable and easier to work with.

steps.title: Prepare Ingredients
steps.description: Preheat oven to 450[degrees]F. Strip thyme leaves, discarding stems. Thinly slice garlic. Peel onion, halve, and thinly slice. Rinse remaining produce. Cut carrots on a diagonal into .25-inch slices. Tear kale into bite-size pieces, discarding stems. Halve fennel lengthwise, cut out and discard core, and thinly slice (see Recipe Tip). Shred or finely chop taleggio.

steps.title: Roast Fennel and Carrots
steps.description: On a baking sheet, toss carrots and fennel with 1.5 tablespoons olive oil, .5 teaspoon kosher salt, and pepper. Arrange in a single layer, transfer to oven, and roast until tender, 10-12 minutes. Transfer to a plate and set aside.

steps.title: Sauté Onion and Kale
steps.description: While fennel and carrots roast, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. When oil is shimmering, add garlic and onion and sauté, stirring occasionally, until onion is tender and beginning to brown, about 5 minutes. Add kale and 1 tablespoon water and cook until bright green and tender, 2-3 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Taste and add salt and pepper as needed and set aside.

steps.title: Assemble Galette
steps.description: Reduce oven temperature to 400[degrees]F. Line baking sheet from vegetables with parchment paper. Carefully remove pie crust from tin and transfer to prepared baking sheet. Arrange sautéed onion and kale in an even layer in center. Sprinkle over goat cheese and taleggio, dividing evenly. Top with roasted carrots and fennel. Sprinkle over thyme.

steps.title: Bake Galette
steps.description: Flatten down pie crust edges to create a 1-inch border around vegetables, pinching together any cracks. Sprinkle pecorino over filling, transfer to oven, and bake until crust is golden, 12-15 minutes.

steps.title: Plate Galette
steps.description: Remove galette from oven and set aside to cool for about 5 minutes. Cut into slices and live the dream: Pie for dinner! If you have any unclaimed slices, cover in foil or plastic wrap and store in refrigerator for up to 3 days.
